articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Major 7th in F# (Shape: G)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Major 7th in F# (Shape: G)

An arpeggio is a musical technique where notes in a chord are played one after the other, rather than simultaneously. The Major 7th arpeggio in F# (corresponding to the G shape) consists of the notes F#, A#, C#, and E#. This arpeggio creates a lush and sophisticated sound due to the major 7th interval, adding a jazzy and modern flavor to the music.

## Notes and Intervals:
- F# (Root)
- A# (Major 3rd)
- C# (Perfect 5th)
- E# (Major 7th)

## Genre and Flavor:
This arpeggio is commonly used in jazz, fusion, and contemporary music genres. It adds a sense of sophistication, elegance, and tension to the music, making it popular in more complex harmonic contexts.

## Songs:
1. "Spain" by Chick Corea
2. "Fragile" by Sting
3. "Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones
